intro: Elcismia discolor, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Elcismia discolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for various pollinators.
